topic.para: The procedures in this guide lead to a minimal setup of a three-node &ha; cluster with the following properties:

listitem.para: Three cluster nodes: &node1;, &node2; and &node3;. Three nodes are required for this setup so that diskless &sbd; can handle split-brain scenarios without the help of &qdevice;.
Diskless &sbd; and a software watchdog used as the node fencing mechanism. This avoids split-brain scenarios.
Failover of resources from one node to another if the active host breaks down (active/passive setup).

topic.para: You can use the three-node cluster for testing purposes or as a minimal cluster configuration that you can extend later. Before using the cluster in a production environment, modify the cluster according to your requirements.
